segment.source: The Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) infrastructure provides the foundation for Windows Performance Toolkit.
segment.target: The Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) infrastructure provides the foundation for Windows Performance Toolkit.

segment.source: These tools provide a set of programs that hide the complexity of working directly with the ETW application programming interfaces (APIs).
segment.target: These tools provide a set of programs that hide the complexity of working directly with the ETW application programming interfaces (APIs).

segment.source: This article provides a high-level introduction to ETW.
segment.target: This article provides a high-level introduction to ETW.

segment.source: For more information about ETW, see Event Tracing.
segment.target: For more information about ETW, see Event Tracing.

segment.source: ETW enables the consistent, straightforward capture of kernel and application events.
segment.target: ETW enables the consistent, straightforward capture of kernel and application events.

segment.source: You can enable or disable event capture at any time without restarting the system or process.
segment.target: You can enable or disable event capture at any time without restarting the system or process.

segment.source: Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) presents the information that ETW collects in an easy-to-understand set of graphs and tables.
segment.target: Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) presents the information that ETW collects in an easy-to-understand set of graphs and tables.

segment.source: You can capture and present selected events to non-invasively identify and diagnose system and application performance issues.
segment.target: You can capture and present selected events to non-invasively identify and diagnose system and application performance issues.

segment.source: You can enable or disable event tracing dynamically.
segment.target: You can enable or disable event tracing dynamically.

segment.source: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) uses ETW to gather and organize critical system information.
segment.target: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) uses ETW to gather and organize critical system information.

segment.source: WPR acts as the session controller, starting and stopping the session and selecting which ETW events to record.
segment.target: WPR acts as the session controller, starting and stopping the session and selecting which ETW events to record.

segment.source: WPA consumes the event trace log (ETL) file that all event providers produce in an ETW session.
segment.target: WPA consumes the event trace log (ETL) file that all event providers produce in an ETW session.

segment.source: Kernel and application events can provide extensive details about the operation of the system.
segment.target: Kernel and application events can provide extensive details about the operation of the system.

segment.source: Almost every kernel event that affects overall system performance is defined and available to WPA.
segment.target: Almost every kernel event that affects overall system performance is defined and available to WPA.
